Free as in the verb.

Notes to developers

If you are interested in contributing code you might find useful to know the rules I try to follow while writing code. All the code will be Java 6, written mostly using the Sun Java coding conventions. One difference is the use of two space indents (instead of four). No tabs shall be used (this is unspecified by Sun). One rule commonly forgot that I care about is to "avoid lines longer than 80 characters." OK, enough with the boring stuff. Now on to (slightly) less religious decisions. One form of external dependency allowed is a jar file in the lib directory. Developers will also need ant and junit. No other external dependency is allowed. The commands ant, ant test, and ant doc should always work in the repository.
